de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.algorithm.clustering.biclustering
Class PClustering<V extends RealVector<V,Double>>

java.lang.Object

      de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.utilities.optionhandling.AbstractParameterizable

                  de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.algorithm.clustering.biclustering.PClustering<V>
Type Parameters:
V - a certain subtype of RealVector - the data matrix is supposed to consist of rows where each row relates to an object of type V and the columns relate to the attribute values of these objects
All Implemented Interfaces:
Algorithm<V>, Loggable, Parameterizable
public class PClustering<V extends RealVector<V,Double>>
extends AbstractBiclustering<V>

Provides a BiclusteringAlgorithm which finds a bicluster based on all of its 2 × 2 submatrices. If all 2 × 2 submatrices of one m × n Matrix have a score ≤ sigma, this m × n -Matrix is considered to be a bicluster. On this way it avoids replacing already found biclusters with random values. The Algorithm finds biclusters with correlated values. It finds more bicluster at one time, which may overlap.

Author:
Noemi Andor
